verses.verse: Who is as the wise <S%H2450><s%> man <S%H3045><s%>? and who knoweth the interpretation <S%H6592><s%> of a thing <S%H1697><s%>? A man <S%H120><s%>'s wisdom <S%H2451><s%> maketh his face <S%H6440><s%> to shine <S%H215><s%>, and the hardness <S%H5797><s%> of his face <S%H6440><s%> is changed <S%H8132><s%>.
I counsel thee <S%H8104><s%>, Keep the king <S%H4428><s%>'s command <S%H6310><s%>, and that in regard <S%H1700><s%> of the oath <S%H7621><s%> of God <S%H430><s%>.

Be not hasty <S%H926><s%> to go out <S%H3212><s%> of his presence <S%H6440><s%>; persist <S%H5975><s%> not in an evil <S%H7451><s%> thing <S%H1697><s%>: for he doeth <S%H6213><s%> whatsoever pleaseth him <S%H2654><s%>.
For the king <S%H4428><s%>'s word <S%H1697><s%> hath power <S%H7983><s%>; and who may say <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H6213><s%>, What doest thou?

Whoso keepeth <S%H8104><s%> the commandment <S%H4687><s%> shall know <S%H3045><s%> no evil <S%H7451><s%> thing <S%H1697><s%>; and a wise man <S%H2450><s%>'s heart <S%H3820><s%> discerneth <S%H3045><s%> time <S%H6256><s%> and judgment <S%H4941><s%>:
for to every purpose <S%H2656><s%> there is <S%H3426><s%> a time <S%H6256><s%> and judgment <S%H4941><s%>; because the misery <S%H7451><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> is great upon him <S%H7227><s%>:
for he knoweth <S%H3045><s%> not that which shall be <S%H5046><s%>; for who can tell him how it shall be?

There is no man <S%H120><s%> that hath power <S%H7989><s%> over the spirit <S%H7307><s%> to retain <S%H3607><s%> the spirit <S%H7307><s%>; neither hath he power <S%H7983><s%> over the day <S%H3117><s%> of death <S%H4194><s%>; and there is no discharge <S%H4917><s%> in war <S%H4421><s%>: neither shall wickedness <S%H7562><s%> deliver <S%H4422><s%> him that is given to it <S%H1167><s%>.

All this have I seen <S%H7200><s%>, and applied <S%H5414><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> unto every work <S%H4639><s%> that is done <S%H6213><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>: there is a time <S%H6256><s%> wherein one man <S%H120><s%> hath power <S%H7980><s%> over another to his hurt <S%H7451><s%>.

So <S%H3651><s%> I saw <S%H7200><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> buried <S%H6912><s%>, and they came <S%H935><s%> to the grave <S%H1980><s%>; and they that had done <S%H6213><s%> right went away from the holy <S%H6918><s%> place <S%H4725><s%>, and were forgotten <S%H7911><s%> in the city <S%H5892><s%>: this also is vanity <S%H1892><s%>.

Because sentence <S%H6599><s%> against an evil <S%H7451><s%> work <S%H4639><s%> is not executed <S%H6213><s%> speedily <S%H4120><s%>, therefore the heart <S%H3820><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%> is fully set <S%H4390><s%> in them to do <S%H6213><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%>.

Though a sinner <S%H2398><s%> do <S%H6213><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> a hundred times <S%H3967><s%>, and prolong <S%H748><s%> his days <S%H3045><s%>, yet surely I know that it shall be well <S%H2896><s%> with them that fear <S%H3373><s%> God <S%H430><s%>, that fear <S%H3373><s%> before him <S%H6440><s%>:

but it shall not be well <S%H2896><s%> with the wicked <S%H7563><s%>, neither shall he prolong <S%H748><s%> his days <S%H3117><s%>, which are as a shadow <S%H6738><s%>; because he feareth <S%H3373><s%> not before <S%H6440><s%> God <S%H430><s%>.

There is <S%H3426><s%> a vanity <S%H1892><s%> which is done <S%H6213><s%> upon the earth <S%H776><s%>, that there are righteous <S%H6662><s%> men unto whom it happeneth <S%H5060><s%> according to the work <S%H4639><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%>; again <S%H3426><s%>, there are wicked <S%H7563><s%> men to whom it happeneth <S%H5060><s%> according to the work <S%H4639><s%> of the righteous <S%H6662><s%>: I said <S%H559><s%> that this also <S%H1571><s%> is vanity <S%H1892><s%>.

Then I commended <S%H7623><s%> mirth <S%H8057><s%>, because a man <S%H120><s%> hath no better thing <S%H2896><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>, than to eat <S%H398><s%>, and to drink <S%H8354><s%>, and to be joyful <S%H8055><s%>: for that shall abide <S%H3867><s%> with him in his labor <S%H5999><s%> all the days <S%H3117><s%> of his life <S%H2416><s%> which God <S%H430><s%> hath given <S%H5414><s%> him under the sun <S%H8121><s%>.

When I applied <S%H5414><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> to know <S%H3045><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%>, and to see <S%H7200><s%> the business <S%H6045><s%> that is done <S%H6213><s%> upon the earth <S%H776><s%> (for also there is that neither day <S%H3117><s%> nor night <S%H3915><s%> seeth <S%H7200><s%> sleep <S%H8142><s%> with his eyes <S%H5869><s%>),

then I beheld <S%H7200><s%> all the work <S%H4639><s%> of God <S%H430><s%>, that man <S%H120><s%> cannot <S%H3201><s%> find out <S%H4672><s%> the work <S%H4639><s%> that is done <S%H6213><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>: because <S%H834><s%> however <S%H7945><s%> much a man <S%H120><s%> labor <S%H5998><s%> to seek it out <S%H1245><s%>, yet he shall not find <S%H4672><s%> it <S%H2450><s%>; yea moreover, though a wise man think <S%H559><s%> to know <S%H3045><s%> it <S%H3201><s%>, yet shall he not be able to find it <S%H4672><s%>.
